column1:
query='Describe the process and key strategies Felipe Aros employed in the development of the Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) system at Digitaltex. Include details on how he ensured the precision of the system and the role of benchmarking in optimizing its performance.' contexts=['Felipe Aros
Santiago, Chile |569-98254228 |felipe.aros.r@gmail.com |github.com/felipearosr
Professional Summary
Results-driven professional with expertise in Machine Learning Engineering and Software Development. Proven track record
in designing and implementing high-precision Retrieval-Augmented Generation systems, optimizing performance through
rigorous benchmarking. Experienced in engineering web applications and leading AI research projects with successful in-
ternational collaboration. Seeking opportunities to leverage skills in machine learning, software development, and project
leadership for innovative solutions and client satisfaction.
Experience
Generative AI - RAG Systems December 2022 – Present
Digitaltex Santiago, Chile
•Led the development of an advanced Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) system for a prominent client, utilizing
a diverse dataset of over 100 documents to ensure unparalleled precision in information retrieval.
•Demonstrated expertise in grounding large language models (LLMs) on accurate and up-to-date information, sur-
passing client expectations and delivering a highly accurate RAG system.
•Conducted rigorous benchmarking of multiple RAG system iterations, systematically analyzing and comparing per-
formance metrics to optimize efficiency and effectiveness.
•Fostered transparent collaboration with the client throughout the development and benchmarking phases, resulting
in a technically superior RAG system tailored to meet specific needs and expectations.
Machine Learning Engineer June 2022 – December 2022
Gecko Santiago, Chile
•Engineered a web application utilizing an in house ML model to accurately identify and mark road signs in images,
capturing their position, type, and direction.
•Implemented website optimization strategies to enhance overall user experience and performance.
•Executed responsive design principles across the entire web application, ensuring seamless usability across various
devices.
Customer Data Platform (CDP) Development Manager July 2021 – June 2022
Eureka Labs Santiago, Chile
•Led a team in the development and research of Customer Data Platform (CDP) tools, collaborating with international
providers for their implementation in national trade.
•Effectively communicated with software providers worldwide, fostering collaboration with teams from the United
States, Poland, and India.
•Managed and implemented new applications, contributing to improved documentation processes.
•Executed the implementation of diverse CDP services in various e-commerce settings.
Education
Universidad Diego Portales Santiago, Chile
Civil Engineering in Computer Science and Telecommunications Jan. 2018 – Dec. 2023
42 Silicon Valley San Francisco, USA
Study abroad in Computer Science Aug. 2014 – May 2018
Technical Skills
Languages : Python, Java, C/C++, SQL (Postgres), JavaScript, HTML/CSS
Frameworks : React, Node.js, Flask, FastAPI
Developer Tools : Git, Docker, TravisCI, Google Cloud Platform, VS Code, Visual Studio, PyCharm, IntelliJ, Eclipse
Libraries : pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib
Language Proficiency
Spanish : Native
English : Advanced (C1)'] response='Felipe Aros led the development of an advanced Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) system at Digitaltex, focusing on delivering a solution with unparalleled precision in information retrieval. The process began with the utilization of a diverse dataset comprising over 100 documents. This extensive dataset was instrumental in ensuring that the RAG system could retrieve accurate and up-to-date information, which is crucial for grounding large language models (LLMs) effectively.

To ensure the precision of the system, Aros demonstrated his expertise by surpassing client expectations through the delivery of a highly accurate RAG system. This achievement was partly due to his methodical approach to grounding LLMs, ensuring they were based on the most accurate and current information available.

Benchmarking played a critical role in optimizing the performance of the RAG system. Aros conducted rigorous benchmarking of multiple iterations of the RAG system, systematically analyzing and comparing performance metrics. This approach allowed for the identification of areas for improvement, ensuring that each version of the system was more efficient and effective than the last.

Throughout the development and benchmarking phases, Aros fostered transparent collaboration with the client. This collaborative approach ensured that the RAG system was tailored to meet the specific needs and expectations of the client, resulting in a technically superior solution. Through these strategies, Felipe Aros successfully leveraged his skills in machine learning and software development to create an innovative and client-satisfactory RAG system at Digitaltex.' passing=True feedback='YES' score=1.0 pairwise_source=None invalid_result=False invalid_reason=None

English : Advanced (C1)'] response="Felipe Aros's study abroad experience at 42 Silicon Valley likely played a significant role in shaping his expertise in Machine Learning Engineering and Software Development. This innovative educational institution is known for its hands-on, project-based learning approach, which emphasizes real-world skills in computer science and software engineering. By immersing himself in this environment, Aros would have had the opportunity to work on complex projects, collaborate with peers from diverse backgrounds, and solve practical problems using cutting-edge technologies. This experience would have not only honed his technical skills in programming languages and frameworks but also fostered a deep understanding of machine learning concepts and applications.

Moreover, the collaborative and self-directed learning model at 42 Silicon Valley would have been instrumental in developing Aros's project leadership abilities. The institution's unique pedagogy encourages students to take initiative, lead projects, and work effectively in teams. These experiences are invaluable for someone looking to lead AI research projects and engineer web applications, as they teach how to manage timelines, communicate effectively with stakeholders, and guide a team towards achieving technical excellence.

In summary, the study abroad experience at 42 Silicon Valley likely provided Aros with a solid foundation in both the technical and soft skills required for his career in Machine Learning Engineering and Software Development. It would have equipped him with the ability to tackle complex technical challenges, lead projects with confidence, and collaborate effectively with international teams, all of which are evident in his professional achievements post-study." passing=True feedback='YES' score=1.0 pairwise_source=None invalid_result=False invalid_reason=None
